definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment was white and glistering.
sentences.chinese: 正祷告的时候，他的面貌就改变了，衣服洁白放光。

sentences.english: The more modern face of China reasserts itself a few hours later in the district of Kundu.
sentences.chinese: 中国更为现代的面貌在昆都数小时后再次体现。

sentences.english: It won't by easy against a new-look Pompey reckons Rick.
sentences.chinese: 里克估计与面貌一新的庞贝较量将不会容易。

sentences.english: But signs of renewal are evident throughout the city.
sentences.chinese: 但全市恢复活力的新面貌已清晰可见。

sentences.english: A good face is a letter of rmendation.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的面貌就是保举书。

sentences.english: To marry a woman for her style is like buying a house for its paint.
sentences.chinese: 由于面貌美丽而娶妻，犹如油漆漂亮而买屋。

sentences.english: As the face of America has changed, so has the face of American racism.
sentences.chinese: 随着美国的面貌改变，美国种族主义也改头换面了。

sentences.english: Straighten curly hair with a flat iron for a sleek new look.
sentences.chinese: 卷曲的头发拉直与扁铁的时尚新面貌。

sentences.english: He's going to have a new look.
sentences.chinese: 他将会有一个崭新的面貌。

sentences.english: The old streets and shops in Sannen-zaka, Kyoto, still retain their original character. (Frank Carter/LPI)
sentences.chinese: 在京都三年坂，老街和商铺依然保持着原始面貌。

sentences.english: Political pop has a new face in Yin Kun' s oils.
sentences.chinese: 政治通俗画在尹坤的油画中呈现出新的面貌。

sentences.english: In the new century, face a new rangefinder will play a bigger role.
sentences.chinese: 在新的世纪里，面貌一新的测距仪将发挥更大作用。

sentences.english: Features on this site have similar characteristics as the Yinxu Cultures in the Anyang region.
sentences.chinese: 遗存面貌和安阳地区的殷墟文化别无二致。

sentences.english: It seemed that Shanghai has turned on a brand-new look.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，上海已打开崭新的面貌。

sentences.english: Each country's present is affected by its past.
sentences.chinese: 两个国家如今的面貌都受其历史的影响。

sentences.english: He was impressed by the hospitality of the people and the management of the city.
sentences.chinese: 他被深圳人的热情和城市的面貌所吸引。

definition: to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
complete change (idiom); facelift/We're in a wholly new situation.
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
